title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB: The line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);' in the 'org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil' class uses 'Class.forName()' syntax, which causes a 'NoClassDefFoundError' in the CLDC version of SWT.
EB: The line 'static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4);' should be used instead to remove the reflection and avoid the 'NoClassDefFoundError' in the CLDC version of SWT.
SR: To reproduce the issue, verify or use jxeLink or a similar tool and observe the 'NoClassDefFoundError' when running the CLDC version of SWT.
